titleStmt.title: The narrow path of divine truth described from living practice and experience of its three great steps, viz Purgation, illumination & union according to the testimony of the holy scriptures; as also of Thomas a Kempis, the German divinity, Thauler, and such like. Or the sayings of Matthew Weyer reduced into order in three books by J. Spee. Unto which are subjoyned his practical epistles, done above 120 years since in the Dutch, and after the author's death, printed in the German language at Frankfort 1579. And in Latin at Amsterdam 1658. and now in English.
titleStmt.author: Weyer, Matthias, 1521-1560.
Spee, J.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed for Ben Clark in George-Yard in Lombard street,

notesStmt.note: "The epistles of M. Wyer, which he sent to his familiar friends" has a separate dated title page; pagination is continuous.
Signed at end: M.W. He died in the Lord 25 April in the year of our Lord 1560 and of his own age the 39.
